ocr-interpreted-text.ocr-interpreted-line: With a vigour and authority which delighted old Parliamentary friends and foes alike,
the Earl of Avon, the former Sir Anthony Eden, in his maiden speech in the House of
Lords last night, gave a warning that appeasement over Berlin could only lead to war.
To stand Ô¨Årm, he declared, was not to invite war, but the surest way to avert it.
